list.SuggestedAction:
Trip because of thermal overload of 
the motor.
Check process conditions  
Check if the cooling time is too 
short 
Check Ie and trip class settings 
Check current factor if configured

At least one phase current is below 
the phase loss threshold
Check for blown fuse 
Check for loose contacts 
Check contact wear

The current in one phase is below 
the adjusted threshold.
Check supply side 
Check for loose contacts 
Check contact wear

The rotor is locked. Load too heavy 
for motor.

Thermal model reached warning 
level. If overload condition remains 
a trip soon follows.
Check motor load condition 
Check for mechanical problems

PTC element indicated that motor 
temperature is too high
Check motor environment and load 
conditions

list.RootCause:
Summary message. See 
detailed messages for more information.
list.SuggestedAction: See codes 83/84

list.RootCause:
Summary message. See 
detailed messages for 
more information.
list.SuggestedAction: See codes 80...82

list.Indicator:
Motor current below low 
current trip threshold
list.RootCause:
Process 
Load side 
Load side mechanics
list.SuggestedAction:
Motor current is below user-defined 
threshold e.g. motor running idle, 
dry running pump, conveyer belt 
broken ...
Check motor load and motor / pro-
cess conditions. Wait until cooling 
time is over.

list.Indicator:
Motor current below low 
current warning threshold
list.RootCause:
Process 
Load side 
Load side mechanics
list.SuggestedAction:
Motor current is below user-defined 
threshold e.g. motor running idle, 
dry running pump, conveyer belt 
broken ...
Check motor load and motor / pro-
cess conditions

list.Indicator:
Motor current above high 
current trip threshold
list.SuggestedAction:
Motor current above threshold 
caused e.g. by jammed equipment
Check process conditions (remove 
blocking cause). Wait until cooling 
time is over.

list.Indicator:
Motor current above high 
current warning threshold
list.SuggestedAction:
Motor current above user-defined 
threshold.
Check motor load and motor / process conditions.

list.Indicator:
Earth fault (external or 
internal sensor) above trip 
threshold
list.SuggestedAction:
Connection between one or more 
phases and ground
Check wiring / motor (isolation 
problem)

Connection between one or more 
phases and ground
Check wiring / motor (isolation 
problem), See above

Hardware fault detected
Replace UMC

Open/close time of actuator ex-
ceeded because of tight valve or 
other mechanical reasons.
Check runtime parameter and limit 
and torque switch wiring

Communication cable not con-
nected. Cable break or IO module 
hardware error.

list.Indicator:
Custom application error 
(e.g. download incom-
plete)
list.SuggestedAction:
An unrecoverable error was de-
tected while processing the custom 
application (e.g. checksum error)
The version of application editor 
and UMC are not compatible

A self-test error was detected in an 
IO module.
Check the LEDs on the module 
Replace the module

list.Indicator:
Aux1: Error or warning 
triggered from auxiliary 
function block input 0
list.SuggestedAction:
The digital input of an IO module 
has created a trip/warning. Reason depends on what you have 
connected to the input. Note: If the "AuxWarnFault" func-
tion block is used in a different way 
than in the predefined applications 
also other inputs than the DX1xx 
can be the fault source.

can be the fault source.

A multifunction input of the UMC 
has triggered a trip.
The reason depends on what you 
have connected to the input.

A multifunction input of the UMC 
has triggered a trip.
The reason depends on what you 
have connected to the input.

A multifunction input of the UMC 
has triggered a trip.
The reason depends on what you 
have connected to the input.

The motor load is too low. Check 
the load e.g. if a pump is running 
dry or a conveyer load is broken.
The motor load is too high. Check if  the load is blocked or tight.

The supply voltage is too low or too 
high. Check the motor supply.

The harmonics on the supply side 
are too high. Check your network.
The motor was started too frequent.
The motor was started too frequent.

Motor was tripped due to thermal 
overload. Restart is possible after 
cooling time is over

Someone tried to write a parameter 
which is outside the specifications
Check the parameter number that 
is causing the problem and change 
the value. 
When writing parameters from 
within a PLC check your program.

list.Indicator:
Torque open in intermedi-
ate position
list.SuggestedAction: Tight operation or wiring problem.

ate position
list.SuggestedAction: Tight operation or wiring problem.

Pos. open and closed at

list.SuggestedAction:

Wiring / position switch problem.

Max. motor operation hours 
reached.
Perform motor maintenance 
Reset counter
N/A
Check supply
Phase order is not L1/L2/L3.

Expected feedback from a contac-
tor is missing after checkback time 
was over.
Check wiring of auxiliary contact to 
the correct UMC input. 
Check contactor 
Increase checkback time

No motor current after motor was 
switched on and checkback time 
was over. Or motor current falls 
below 20% while motor is running.
Check supply side 
Check that Ie was set correctly 
Check current factor if set 
Increase checkback time
Check between UMC and motor

Check wiring between UMC and 
motor

The IO module does not respond 
during start-up of UMC.
Check wiring between UMC and module 
Check supply of module 
Check status LEDs of the module

The VI15x module does not re-
spond during start-up of the UMC. 
Check wiring between UMC and module 
Check supply of module 
Check status LEDs of the module

list.RootCause: Wiring, connected meter has a defect
list.SuggestedAction: Check wiring, short circuit at analogue output
Check Wiring
Check Wiring

list.RootCause:
Motor supply voltage is 
too low.
list.SuggestedAction:
Check supply side: E.g. circuit 
breaker, fuses, wiring and the feed-
ing.

too low.

Check supply side: E.g. circuit 
breaker, fuses, wiring and the feed-
ing.

too high.

list.RootCause:
Active power consumption 
of the motor is too low.
list.SuggestedAction:
Either the motor is idle (not loaded) 
or the motor load is not connected 
because of a broken belt or a dry 
running pump etc.
Check load side

list.RootCause:
Active power consumption 
of the motor is too low.
list.SuggestedAction:
Either the motor is idle (not loaded) 
or the motor load is not connected 
because of a broken belt or a dry 
running pump etc.
Check load side

list.RootCause:
Active power consumption

list.SuggestedAction:

or the motor load is not connected

list.RootCause:
Active power consumption 
of the motor is too low
list.SuggestedAction:

because of a broken belt or a dry

list.RootCause:
No voltage on one more 
phases. Possible causes 
are a blown fuse or a wire 
break.
list.SuggestedAction:
Check fuses 
Check wiring on supply side.

list.RootCause:
There is a high imbal-
ance on supply side e.g. 
because of unsymmetrical 
load of the three phases.
list.SuggestedAction:
Check supply side especially the 
fuses and supply line.

list.RootCause:
The voltage is out of the 
specified voltage range
list.SuggestedAction: Check supply side. See 95 – 98.

list.RootCause:
The phases were wired in 
incorrect order.
list.SuggestedAction: Check wiring

list.RootCause:
Undervoltage / no voltage 
situation is too long
list.SuggestedAction:
The DIP took longer than config-
ured in parameter  Voltage Dip 
Duration

list.RootCause:
A problem occured dur-
ing parameter exchange 
between the UMC and the 
LCD panel.
list.SuggestedAction:
Check that the parameters / appli-
cation stored in the LCD panel can 
be handled from the used UMC.
Do not remove the panel while 
parameter exchange
Do not remove power while parameter exchange.
